byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER and DAVID MASELLO

abstract: Fate of 1962 Richard Lippold sculpture Orpheus and Apollo remains unclear almost two years after being removed from grand foyer of Avery Fisher Hall, now known as David Geffen Hall, for maintenance; Lincoln Center officials decline to speculate on whether work will be reinstalled after hall's renovation, which is scheduled to begin in 2019.
lead_paragraph: The fate of Richard Lippold’s immense, gravity-defying metal sculpture at Lincoln Center, removed in 2014 for cleaning and restoration, remains uncertain.

headline.main: ‘Orpheus and Apollo,’ Dismantled, May Be Gone for Years, Some Fear Permanently

snippet: The fate of Richard Lippold’s immense, gravity-defying metal sculpture at Lincoln Center, removed in 2014 for cleaning and restoration, remains uncertain.

keywords.value: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
